entries.title: 'Through the Cracks': Inside the fight to fix Jackson's Water Crisis
entries.description: Check out Senior Congressional Correspondent Rachel Scott's full report, "Through the Cracks" tonight on "Prime with Linsey Davis," on ABC News Live.

entries.title: Suspected white supremacists arrested in plot to destroy Baltimore: Prosecutors
entries.description: A Florida man and a Maryland woman have been arrested on federal charges of plotting to attack multiple energy substation with the goal of destroying Baltimore.

entries.title: Hundreds of ready-to-eat sandwiches, more fresh food products recalled
entries.description: Baltimore-based Fresh Ideation Food Group is recalling products sold from Jan. 24 through 30 over potential listeria contamination.

entries.title: Balloon incident shows China's growing 'arrogance': Expert
entries.description: ABC News contributor and former State Department official Col. Stephen Ganyard shares his thoughts over the alleged Chinese spy balloon that flew across the country.

entries.title: Hawaii firefighter dies after being swept into storm drain
entries.description: Officials say a firefighter who was swept into a storm drain while responding to a storm on the Hawaiian island of Maui died over the weekend

entries.title: 3 mainland US tourists stabbed in Puerto Rico neighborhood
entries.description: Police say three tourists from the U.S. mainland were stabbed in Puerto Rico after someone told them to stop filming in a renowned seaside community known as La Perla that is popular with visitors

entries.title: Police: Man fatally shot by Indiana cops fired several shots
entries.description: Police say a man who was fatally shot during an exchange of gunfire with southern Indiana law enforcement officers over the weekend had fired several shots

entries.title: Antisemitic fliers left in driveways of some Atlanta suburbs: Police
entries.description: Police in two Atlanta suburbs are on the hunt for a suspect or suspects that left antisemitic fliers on some residents' driveways on Sunday, authorities said.

entries.title: WATCH:  Crystal-clear ice covers Lake Superior
entries.description: Subzero temperatures created a layer of crystal-clear ice over an area of Lake Superior in Michigan.

entries.title: WATCH:  Murmuration of starlings swoops through sky
entries.description: A murmuration of starlings swoops across the sky over a town in England.

entries.title: Poland redeploys Patriot missiles to capital city for drills
entries.description: Poland's Defense Ministry says Patriot missile batteries acquired from the U.S. last year have been deployed to the capital city Warsaw as part of military exercise

entries.title: Norway looks to donate $7.3 billion in aid to Ukraine
entries.description: The government of oil-rich Norway is looking to donate 75 billion kroner ($7.3 billion) in a multiyear support package to Ukraine

entries.title: 48 arrested in Europe over encrypted app used in drug trade
entries.description: German authorities say European investigators have shut down an encrypted communication service that was used as a secure channel for organized crime particularly in the drug trade and arrested 48 people

entries.title: 3.8 magnitude earthquake strikes Buffalo, New York, suburbs
entries.description: A 3.8 magnitude earthquake struck the suburbs of Buffalo, New York, early Monday morning, according to the U.S. Geological Survey.

entries.title: Americans have low confidence in leaders, GOP at risk in political disputes: POLL
entries.description: Americans expressed scant confidence in President Joe Biden and his party, as well as Republican counterparts, heading into the 2023 State of the Union address.

entries.title: 'Loophole' excuses WHO officials accused of misconduct
entries.description: A confidential U_N_ report into the alleged missteps by senior World Health Organization staffers in how they handled a sexual misconduct case during an Ebola outbreak in Congo found their response didn't violate the agency’s policies because of what s...

entries.title: UK nurses, ambulance crews strike, straining health system
entries.description: Tens of thousands of nurses and ambulance staff are walking off the job in the U.K. in what unions called the biggest strike in the history of the country's public health system

entries.title: Bomb kills soldier, wounds 11 people in southwest Pakistan
entries.description: Pakistani officials say a bombing killed a soldier and wounded 11 others, mostly civilians, in southwestern Pakistan

entries.title: Officials: Israeli troops kill 5 Palestinian gunmen in raid
entries.description: Israeli security officials say Israeli forces killed five Palestinian gunmen in a raid on a West Bank refugee camp

entries.title: China-Australia trade ministers hold 1st meeting since 2019
entries.description: Australian and Chinese trade ministers are holding their first bilateral meeting since 2019 as Australia urges China to lift barriers that are costing exporters $14 billion a year

entries.title: Asian stocks sink after US jobs data fan rate hike fears
entries.description: Asian stock markets are lower after strong U.S. jobs data fanned fears of more interest rate hikes to cool inflation

entries.title: Swiss lawmakers visit Taiwan, say they want closer ties
entries.description: A group of Swiss lawmakers has met with Taiwan’s president and said their government wants to deepen political relations

entries.title: Subversion trial for Hong Kong political activists opens
entries.description: Some of Hong Kong’s best-known pro-democracy activists have gone on trial in the biggest prosecution yet under a law imposed by China’s ruling Communist Party to crush dissent

entries.title: 2023 Grammys recap: Biggest wins, all the star-studded performances and more
entries.description: The 65th annual Grammy Awards was a night filled with history-making wins and plenty of epic performances.

entries.title: Turkey earthquake live updates: At least 175 dead in Turkey, Syria
entries.description: At least 175 people are dead in Turkey and Syria after a 7.8 magnitude earthquake hit the country Monday morning, officials said.

entries.title: Grammys 2023 live updates: Music legends remembered during 'In Memoriam'
entries.description: The 65th Annual Grammy Awards will air live on Sunday, Feb. 5 at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT. Check out updates from music's biggest night.

entries.title: Powerful 7.8 quake knocks down buildings in Turkey, Syria
entries.description: The quake was followed by another strong temblor.

entries.title: Kidnapped children from Missouri found at Florida supermarket 1 year later: Police
entries.description: Two Missouri children were found inside a supermarket in Florida nearly a year after they were abducted, officials said.
